topic.title: Overview

body.p: The GCC Subsystem coordinates extraction and insertion of GCC bytes between the ODU_OHP and an external device.

The ODU_OHP coordinates with the Framers directly. GCC overhead (GCC0, GCC1 and GCC2) OTN Frame Overhead Structure are extracted from each channel in the receive framer stage and inserted into each channel in the transmit framer stage.

The GCC Processor block connects to the framer 1 or N ODU_OHP block in the COREOTN Subsystem. The ODU_OHP framer 1/N connection is shown in the COREOTN Subsystem block diagram COREOTN Functional Block Diagram. The COREOTN Server OTN Interface is connected to the stage 1 framer and the COREOTN Client OTN interface is connected to the stage N framer. GCC Links can be combined for a GCCx within an ODUCn (n=1 to 6) or per each HO within the ODUCn. The transmission medium for the GCC Link data is through a SGMII link that runs at 1 GE full-duplex rate. The GCC Processor block connection to the SGMII is shown in the COREOTN Subsystem block diagram COREOTN Subsystem. The framer stage 1 isframers stages 1 and N are HO OTU/ODU. The GCC Links are HDLC line-encoded in bit stuffed framing. To achieve maximum sustained rate per link, the HDLC payload size must be a minimum of 40B. HDLC stuffing will increase this for insertion into the GCC overhead in OTN and the Ethernet framing will increase the packet size on the Ethernet I/F.
